_meta.description: Random scene prompts for ambient scenes when no beat is queued

seeds.prompt: Morning in the Phi Delta Phi kitchen. The coffee maker gurgles. Sunlight slants through the windows. Someone else is already awake.
The common room in the afternoon. Someone's left the TV on. A sister or two might be around, doing their own thing.
Evening on the porch. The day's heat is fading. You can hear voices from inside, but out here it's quiet.
Late at night. The house is mostly quiet, but not entirely. Floorboards creak. Someone's light is still on under their door.
The laundry room. Machines rumble. It's one of the few places in the house you can have a conversation without being overheard.
The backyard. Someone left a volleyball net up. A forgotten towel on a lawn chair. Space to breathe.
Someone needs to make a grocery run. You could use the air, or the company.
Rain drums against the windows. Everyone's stuck inside. The house feels smaller, closer.
Sunday brunch tradition. Someone's cooking. The smell of bacon fills the house. It's one of the rare moments everyone's in the same room.
Someone declared it movie night. The couch is too small for everyone. Someone's making popcorn.
Midterms are coming. The library is full of stressed sisters. Maybe they need a distraction.
A package arrived. It's addressed to one of the sisters. You could bring it to her.
Something's broken. The dishwasher, maybe. Or the AC. Someone's frustrated about it.
Someone came home late last night. The rumor mill is spinning up. You hear whispers.
The house has a small gym in the basement. Someone's already down there, or about to be.
A rare quiet moment. The house feels empty, even though you know it's not. Time to think.
You didn't mean to overhear. But the walls are thin, and someone's having an intense phone call.
Someone's at the door. A visitor for one of the sisters. The energy in the house shifts.
Someone's trying to save the garden out back. It's not going well. They could use help, or company.
The power's out. Candles and flashlights. The house feels different in the dark.
